comment.author: 47524421@N08
comment._content: Hawker Tornado HG641, the third prototype, powered by a Bristol Centaurus CE.4S 18 cylinder sleeve valve radial engine, first flown on 23 October 1941. This was when the Air Ministry was pursuing 12 gun fighters, this one being equipped with a dozen Browning .303 machine guns.   Built from two incomplete production Tornado airframes (R7937 and R7938), this aircraft was a test-bed for several Centaurus-prop combinations, and was the progenitor of the Hawker Tempest II.
